title: Drawing, "Church Triumphant over Falsehood", ca. 1700
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and wash, black chalk on paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Drawing of falsehood depicted as a woman falling over while a bishop pulls off her mask.  He is seated with a chalice in his other hand.  Looking over his shoulder is the Virgin Mary (?) and a bird flies over at center.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Church Triumphant over Falsehood", ca. 1700.
ca. 1700. Pen and brown ink, brush and wash, black chalk on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-6437.
